document.docTitle: Cyanus triumfettii subsp. triumfettii subsp. triumfettii
document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of the genus Cyanus (Asteraceae, Cardueae) in Turkey, with notes on taxonomy and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of the genus Cyanus (Asteraceae, Cardueae) in Turkey, with notes on taxonomy and distribution

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Centaurea atrata Willdenow (1803: 2290)
.
Centaurea axillaris var. atrata (Willd.) Boissier (1875: 636)
.
Cyanus atratus (Willd.) Holub (1972: 316)
. Type:— TURKEY . Habitat in Anatolia, Tournefort & Gundelsheimer s.n. ( holotype B-W 16556 -01 0!).

Centaurea huetii Boissier (1856: 69)
.
Cyanus huetii (Boiss.) Soják (1972: 131)
. Type:— TURKEY . Circa Erzeroum, prope Satchernik, July 1853 , Huet du Pavillon s.n. ( holotype G-BOIS! (G00765968), isotypes BM000552046!, G00414391!, JE00022010!, K000794257!).

Centaurea cana f. fulgens Bornmüller (1944: 375)
, syn. nova.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type :— TURKEY . In monte Göl-dagh ,
June 1893
, Bornmüller 3405 ( holotype B 10 0367382!)
.

Taxonomic notes: —
Centaurea cana f. fulgens
was described by Bornmüller (1944) . The epithet “ fulgens ” means bright-coloured, regarding the appendages of phyllaries. My examination of herbarium sheets of
C. triumfettii
deposited at different herbaria confirms the presence of bright-coloured appendages, so that this form is proposed as a synonym of
C. triumfettii
.

Selected specimens examined:—
